conclusion: Analyze v-t graphs to calculate positions at t=10s.
Car A travels at constant velocity of 40 m/s from t=0 to t=30s.
Car B's velocity increases linearly from 0 m/s at t=0 to some velocity at t=30s.
At t=30s, Car B's velocity is 60 m/s.
Car A's displacement at t=30s is 1200 m.
Car B's displacement at t=30s is 900 m.
Car B starts 300 m ahead of Car A at t=0.
Car A's position at t=10s is 400 m.
Car B's position at t=10s is 400 m.
At t=10s, Car A and Car B are side by side.
At t=10s, Car A's velocity is 40 m/s, Car B's velocity is 20 m/s.
Car B's acceleration allows it to catch up to Car A by t=10s.
Final answer: At t=10s, Car A is neither ahead nor behind Car B.
